security_audit.summary: All 81 static findings are false positives. Scanner misinterpreted CSS syntax (rgba opacity values as cryptographic algorithms, backtick-like patterns) and design guidance text (look/study/avoid as system reconnaissance). No actual security risks present. This is legitimate interface design documentation.

content.value_statement: Interface defaults produce generic, templated results. This skill teaches intent-first design principles that help you create dashboards, admin panels, and tools that feel crafted and specific to their domain.
actual_capabilities: Generate interface code with craft and intentionality
Apply subtle layering principles for professional polish
Build design tokens and surface elevation systems
Create navigation, data displays, and form controls
Implement light and dark mode interfaces
Save and reuse patterns through system.md memory
limitations: Does not handle marketing or landing page design
Does not create illustration, iconography, or brand assets
Requires user input on domain and target audience for best results
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma or Sketch

prompt_templates.title: Basic Dashboard Request

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Interface Specification
prompt_templates.prompt: I need an interface for [specific feature]. The users are [description] who need to [task]. The feel should be [descriptor]. Before building, explore the domain and produce: domain concepts, color world, signature element, and defaults to reject.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern Extension
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend the [component type] to handle [new case]. Follow our system.md patterns: [reference key values]. Maintain consistency with [existing components].

prompt_templates.title: System Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit my current interface code against our system.md. Check: spacing consistency, depth strategy adherence, color token usage, and pattern reuse.

best_practices: Start with domain exploration before any visual decisions. Understand who the users are, what they need to accomplish, and how it should feel.
Apply subtle layering consistently. Surfaces should be barely different but still distinguishable. Test with the squint test.
Build and maintain a system.md file. Save patterns, measurements, and decisions to compound quality over time.
anti_patterns: Using default card layouts without adapting them to specific content types
Reaching for warm/cold color labels instead of exploring the actual product domain
Mixing depth strategies (borders, shadows, color shifts) within the same interface

faq.question: What types of interfaces does this skill handle?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on dashboards, admin panels, SaaS tools, settings pages, and data-rich interfaces. Redirect marketing or landing page requests to a frontend design skill.

faq.question: How does this skill differ from generic UI generation?
faq.answer: It uses an intent-first approach. Before generating code, it explores the product domain, identifies unique elements, and rejects common defaults. The goal is specific, crafted interfaces rather than generic templates.

faq.question: What are surface tokens and why do they matter?
faq.answer: Surface tokens define elevation hierarchy through subtle color shifts. Professional interfaces use barely-visible differences between levels so hierarchy emerges without demanding attention.

faq.question: How should I handle dark mode?
faq.answer: Lean on borders over shadows since shadows are less visible on dark backgrounds. Adjust semantic colors to be slightly desaturated. The hierarchy system stays the same but values invert.

faq.question: What is system.md and how do I use it?
faq.answer: system.md is a memory file that saves patterns, measurements, and design decisions. Update it when you create reusable components or establish conventions. Future work should reference and extend existing patterns.

faq.question: How do I create a unique interface identity?
faq.answer: Through the signature element requirement. Every design must include one element that could only exist for that specific product. Combine this with domain exploration and color world mapping to avoid generic output.
